org.firewaterframework.mappers
Class RouteMapper

java.lang.Object
  org.firewaterframework.mappers.Mapper
      org.firewaterframework.mappers.RouteMapper

public class RouteMapper
extends Mapper

This Mapper will delegate incoming REST Requests to downstream Mappers based on the baseUrl of Request. It is typically the top Mapper in the chain. It's purpose is to parse the Request URL, building a symbol table of arguments contained in the URL and to dispatch the Request to another Mapper for handling the actual Request.

A Spring configuration file for creating a top level RouteMapper for handling REST Requests for a simple Pet Store may look like:

Here we have a RouteMapper that handles five URL patterns. If, for example, the RouteMapper were requested to handle an incoming URL pattern like /users/123, it would parse the '123' out of the request, assigning it to the Request object's arguments Map (as userID=123), and delegate the Request onto the userMapper bean.

It is important to realize that the variables inside of the URL patterns must be consistent with each other in name. An error would be raised if the 'userPetsMapper' pattern above contained the URL pattern "/users/{myUserId}/pets".

Nested Class Summary
protected static class RouteMapper.ParseNode
          An internal tree representation of the urlMap to provide rapid pattern matching for incoming REST Request URLs
protected static class RouteMapper.ParseResult
          An aggregate return class for wrapping the resultant Mapper that can handle the incoming URL and the arguments that were collected from the incoming pattern.
 
Field Summary
protected  RouteMapper.ParseNode parseTree
          All URL patterns are combined together into a cached tree structure for efficient lookup.
protected  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Mapper> urlMap
          A Map keyed by URL patterns who's values are the delegate Mapper objects to handle matching incoming Request URLs

Method Detail

handle

public Response handle(Request request)
Process incoming URLs, and delegate them to downstream Mappers based on pattern matching the URL against the stored urlMap.

In addition, all OPTIONS requests are handled by this mapper. A special OPTIONS request on the root '/' of the web service heirarchy indicates to get all of the meta-data for the entire dictionary.

Specified by:
handle in class Mapper
Parameters:
request - the REST Request
Returns:
the Response
